content.description: Not all walks in the park are easy...Start way to the left on a broken crimp, traverse left doing some interesting difficult moves, making your way to the colorful ramp. Walk you hands up the ramp moving into the no fall zone and a terrifying topout. Feel free to drop off before the ramp.Watch out for the large loose block at the top of the ramp.
content.location: Start far to the left on a broken crimp.

content.description: Climb the Crack! this is also the down climb.
content.location: Crack system to the left of the Pocket Slab

content.description: Use wonder full pocket holds on the slab to larger pockets and a fun mantle. Down climb the crack to the right to descend. Love this one
content.location: The middle most line on the Trail Slabs (slab on the Dominatrix Boulder facing the trail)

content.description: Climb up the crack, till the crack splits in twain. Go left or right, or squeeze the whole darn thing! Down climb the crack all the way on the right.
content.location: Starts in the crack on the left side of the slab near the Lunch Roof

content.description: Where are the holds!? Using thin crimps and small feet manuever up into a scary high foot that bring you up into just useble holds to topout.
content.location: In the blank section to the left of the Pocket V0.

content.description: This is a steep, left leaning finger crack that packs a lot of punch for its length.  It's often toproped, less-frequently led, and just a bit too high to be a boulder problem.
content.protection: hands, then quickly goes to less than tips.  Hands-sized gear for the anchor.
content.location: From the campground head southeast toward the Nature Loop Trail, follow for 1/8th mile which is half way through the loop, merge onto a trail called the Cochise Trail (and on some maps such as Google will call it the Sky Island Traverse Trail.) Shortly after this you will cross a (likely) dry stream bed, where the trail will continue with the stream bed on the right. Follow for another 1/3 mile and you will come to a large cluster of boulders that are off of the right side of the trail. This is where the majority of the Cochise Boulder Trail Boulders are. They are between the trail and stream bed and then continue to the other side of the stream bed.The Dominatrix Crack Boulder is large (see map coordinates.) and right off the trail with the crack being on the southeast corner of the boulder.

content.description: Sit on crimps at the bottom of the arete (your butts on the boulder behind you), do a difficult dabby move into the seam. Move up and left to a slopey jug and topout straight up.Down climb to drop off the jugs to the right of the arete or walk to the left side of the boulder (left if your looking at the arete), and carefully chimmeny down.
content.location: Walk around the Dominatrix boulder to the left under the Dominatrix crack and into the Corridor underneath. The arete lies at the end of the corridor over a sandy pit

content.description: The Dominatrix Crack Boulder has at least three problems on it, with the most notable being the Dominatrix Crack itself. Bring many pads and spotters or set-up a top rope or place gear to climb the route.Â
